positions.companyName: The Henry M. Jackson Foundation for the Advancement of Military Medicine

positions.title: GCLP Compliance Specialist- Surgical Critical Care Initiative (SC2i)- Uniformed Services University
positions.description:
•	Joined the Surgical Critical Care Initiative as GCLP Specialist with no knowledge in laboratory compliance and got quickly familiar with the SC2i Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs) and Policies.
•	Now a Subject Matter Expert in GCLP guidelines and CAP (College of American Pathologists) regulations. 
•	Received a cash award from the Henry Jackson Foundation (HJF) for excellent performance and was highlighted on LinkedIn and in the “Scoop” (HJF Magazine). 
•	Responsible for monitoring compliance of the SC2i Quality Management Plan, SOP development (updates, dissemination, maintenance) and support and monitor the laboratory activities
•	Prepared the SC2i laboratories for the Biorepository Accreditation Program (BAP) Audit by the College of American Pathologists (CAP) and received accreditation. This was a very important and challenging project for the whole SC2i team. 
•	Implemented several new procedures for process improvement, like an electronic SOP database, to provide access to policies and documents for all team members and 
a new system for SOP approval, that significantly speeds up the SOP review and approval process.
•	Continuous learner, interested in constant improvement and problem solving. Took several classes over the course of the last seven years (~60 graduate course credits), while maintaining a full-time job. 
•	Completed a Clinical Trial Project Management Class on the weekends during last fall and is currently enrolled in a FDA Regulatory Affairs Class. 
•	Organize and run the 3 -monthly Key Quality Indicators meeting to maintain and improve the standards of the operation. 
•	Supported the lab team in troubleshooting and brought in technical advice from a core laboratory at NIH.

company.name: The Henry M. Jackson Foundation for the Advancement of Military Medicine

positions.companyName: The Henry M. Jackson Foundation for the Advancement of Military Medicine

positions.title: New Technology Scientist,  Research & Foundation
positions.description:
• Used extensive knowledge of basic research and product development to transform fundamental molecular biology research findings into feasible product ideas.  

• Risk-based decision maker who is comfortable assessing data and commercialization potential of products and unafraid to make recommendations to quickly terminate projects that are not profitable or technically feasible. 

• Willing to persevere through the challenges of exploratory research with a “won’t give up” attitude. Always seeking to find creative and novel approaches to impossible challenges, but with a keen awareness to stop when approaching a futile end. 

• Regularly communicate technical concepts, data, and results to diverse stakeholders including: Qiagen senior management, sales and manufacturing teams, other research and development teams, and production teams in a way that is actionable and easy to understand.

educations.degreeName: Master of Science - MS, Cell Biology and Microbiology
Bachelor of Science - BS, Biotechnology and Chemical Engineering (dual degree)
educations.schoolName: University of Applied Sciences Emden/Leer, Germany

educations.degreeName: Conducted a year of research at the university of Vigo in Spain.

allData.headline: Senior Manager - Regulatory and Laboratory Compliance - SC2i-Uniformed Services University at The Henry M. Jackson Foundation for the Advancement of Military Medicine
allData.summary:
•	Subject Matter Expert in GCLP guidelines and CAP (College of American Pathologists) regulations.

•	Responsible for monitoring compliance of the SC2i Quality Management Plan, SOP development (updates, dissemination, maintenance) and support and monitor the laboratory activities

•	Recognized expert in molecular biology research and product development with a record of successfully bringing several concepts to market for over 12 years. 

•	Experienced communicator with the ability to make highly technical information and data accessible to all members of a team.

•	Committed to self-improvement through continuous learning concurrent with a dedication to employment. Spent several years pursuing educational instruction culminating with a MS degree in Cell and Molecular Biology in 2018 - all while maintain a full-time position.
